skill.summary: Diagnoses and fixes CI/CD pipeline failures. Use when user mentions 'CI', 'GitHub Actions', 'GitLab ...
skill.author: Chachamaru127

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-based skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, no network calls, no file writes outside context. Uses only Read/Grep/Bash tools within repository scope.

content.value_statement: CI/CD pipelines fail frequently and debugging takes time. This skill analyzes failure logs, identifies root causes, and provides specific fix recommendations for build and test errors.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes CI/CD failure logs from GitHub Actions and GitLab CI
Identifies error patterns (TypeScript, npm, Jest, environment)
Provides step-by-step fix instructions for failing tests
Routes between analysis and fix workflows based on user intent
Includes error pattern dictionaries for quick reference
limitations: Cannot access private CI systems without gh CLI authentication
Cannot modify CI configuration files directly
Cannot guarantee fix success for complex multi-file issues
Requires user approval for test file modifications

use_cases.title: Analyze CI failure logs
use_cases.description: Extract and interpret GitHub Actions logs to identify root causes of build failures

use_cases.title: Fix failing tests
use_cases.description: Diagnose why tests fail and receive specific guidance on correcting test or implementation code

use_cases.title: Understand build errors
use_cases.description: Get clear explanations of TypeScript, npm, and dependency errors with fix recommendations

prompt_templates.title: Check recent failures
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the recent CI runs and why the latest one failed

prompt_templates.title: Analyze error logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at the GitHub Actions log and tell me why the build is failing

prompt_templates.title: Fix test failures
prompt_templates.prompt: The CI test is failing. Find the failing test and suggest how to fix it

prompt_templates.title: Full CI diagnosis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the CI failure, identify the root cause, and provide a specific fix for the issue

output_examples.input: The CI failed on the latest commit. Can you check why?
output: Root cause: Test expectation is outdated after the refactor in commit abc123
Fix needed: Update the expected value in the test assertion

best_practices: Always verify the root cause before applying fixes to avoid masking real bugs
Run tests locally with npm test before committing changes
Check recent commits to understand what changed when CI starts failing
anti_patterns: Skipping tests with it.skip to make CI pass
Removing assertions instead of fixing the implementation
Bypassing CI checks with continue-on-error settings

faq.question: What CI systems are supported?
faq.answer: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and any CI system accessible via gh CLI or log files.

faq.question: Can this skill fix complex multi-file issues?
faq.answer: For complex cases with 2+ retry cycles, it delegates to the ci-cd-fixer sub-agent for deeper analysis.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: It provides fix guidance. Direct edits require your explicit approval before execution.

faq.question: Is my CI data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis happens locally. Logs are read through the gh CLI within your authenticated context.

faq.question: What if the fix does not work?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes failure reasons first. If the initial fix fails, it escalates to a sub-agent for deeper diagnosis.

faq.question: How is this different from general debugging?
faq.answer: This skill is specialized for CI-specific patterns including TypeScript errors, npm failures, and test timeout scenarios.
